benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Add custom fields to account

covered: Valid Payload: TC01 demonstrates successful creation of custom fields with a valid payload and required headers.
Header/Authorization validation: TC01, TC02, TC03 cover required/optional headers and successful authorization flow, plus TC07 and TC16 cover header presence and unauthorized access.

Invalid inputs and error handling: TC06 (invalid accountId), TC07 (missing header), TC08 (malformed JSON), TC09 (empty body), TC10 (non-existent account), TC11 (unsupported fields), TC12 (duplicate field names), TC26 (empty array), TC27 (partial input), TC28 (invalid data types), TC30 (null values) cover a wide range of input validation and error cases.
Security testing: TC18 (SQL injection) and TC19 (XSS) test basic input sanitization and invalid input handling.
Payload size and boundary tests: TC14 (maximum payload size boundary) and TC15 (payload exceeding size) cover large payload handling.
Availability and resilience: TC17 (service unavailable) and TC20 (recovery from transient network failure) test robustness against backend/service issues.
Performance tests: TC21 (normal load response time) and TC22 (peak load/concurrency) address performance under load.
Regression/Integration: TC23, TC24 (regressions for compatibility), and TC25 (integration with dependent service data) ensure ongoing compatibility and integration behavior.
Edge cases: TC04/TC05 validate creation when account has no existing or already existing custom fields, and TC13 verifies resilience to extra query parameters.
gaps: 403 Forbidden scenarios not explicitly tested (only 401 Unauthorized in TC16).
500 Internal Server Error scenarios not clearly covered (only 503 Service Unavailable in TC17).
Rate limiting / throttling tests are not present.
Caching behavior validation for POST (e.g., Cache-Control/ETag on create) is not tested.
Idempotency / duplicate submission handling is not explicitly tested (beyond field-level duplicates in payload).
Header-format validation beyond CreatedBy (e.g., invalid content-type or malformed header values) is not tested.
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden to cover authorization edge cases beyond 401.
Add a test simulating 500 Internal Server Error to validate server-side failure handling.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling scenarios to verify behavior under burst traffic.
Add caching-related checks for POST responses if applicable (ETag/Cache-Control headers).
Add an explicit idempotency/duplicate-submission test (repeat identical requests and observe behavior).
Include tests validating header formats beyond CreatedBy (e.g., invalid Content-Type or malformed header values).
Consider targeted tests for token-based authentication failures and refresh flows if applicable.
